intro: Rhaptostylum, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often yellow or orange-colored flowers with intricate patterns. These plants are typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Rhaptostylum species have slender stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves that help in photosynthesis. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to their ecological significance in their native habitats.
